page.title: 15RED HOT BUSINESS! MUSTARD
page.content: The{fields}around Sherston were noted for many years for the range of useful {herbs}that were grown, villagers in their sixties can remember the collecting and drying of the plants, flowers and leaves as being a notable local{occupation.}Even now some of the less'managed' fields yield a great variety of{'wild' plants}as do the verges of the minor roads and lanes. Although some 14 years old and originating from Urchfont there is now a business in the village concerned with the production of high quality and unusual{mustard mixes ,sauces and {jellies}for use on both hot and cold meat.The mustards are produced by stone grinding of the seed which is then immediately mixed with the appropiate liquids,{wine- or cider- {vinegar}and other herbs and packed in airtight jars to preserve the flavours
